page.title: 08BENINGTON CASTLE (1)
page.content: One of the features of Benington is the castle known as The Lordship and its gardens. The present Lordship is a Queen Anne period house built upon the remains of an ancient castle and surrounded by outstandingly beautiful gardens. The original site dates back to Saxon times. In 850, Berthulf, King of Mercia is mentioned as having his palace at Benington. The remains of the mound still exist and upon it the evidence of the foundations and keep of a later Norman castle replacing the earlier wooden tower. In 1213 Benington Castle was destroyed by King John and the owner Robert Fitz Walter outlawed. The site was often re- developed in subsequent years and the doings of many owners are recorded in history. (Cont.)
